Sentencas: CexZr(1-x)O(2) mixed oxides nanopowders with x = 0.10, 0.25, 0.50, 0.75 and 0.90, and pure ceria, all prepared by a low temperature citrate complexion technique, were investigated using a range of temperature programmed (TP) techniques in order to evaluate their suitability for use as anode catalyst materials in solid oxide fuel cells operating on hydrocarbon fuels.
Titulo: Redox and catalytic properties of Ce-Zr mixed oxide nanopowders for fuel cell applications

Sentencas: In TP reduction experiments, reduction peak temperatures and peak areas were related to the activity and amount, respectively, of available catalyst oxygen.
Titulo: Redox and catalytic properties of Ce-Zr mixed oxide nanopowders for fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Mixed oxides with higher Ce contents (x = 0.50) were found to be reduced at significantly lower temperatures than samples with x < 0.50.
Titulo: Redox and catalytic properties of Ce-Zr mixed oxide nanopowders for fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The oxide with x = 0.75 supplied the largest amount of labile oxygen.
Titulo: Redox and catalytic properties of Ce-Zr mixed oxide nanopowders for fuel cell applications

Sentencas: TP reaction experiments performed in dry methane on two samples indicated that susceptibility of the oxides to carbon deposition was inversely related to availability of catalyst oxygen.
Titulo: Redox and catalytic properties of Ce-Zr mixed oxide nanopowders for fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Light- off experiments in a stoichiometric CH4/O-2 mixture were performed to investigate the catalytic activity of the mixed oxide compositions for methane oxidation.
Titulo: Redox and catalytic properties of Ce-Zr mixed oxide nanopowders for fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Catalytic activity increased with cerium content to a maximum at x = 0.75 before decreasing at x = 0.90.
Titulo: Redox and catalytic properties of Ce-Zr mixed oxide nanopowders for fuel cell applications

Sentencas: All the mixed oxides were considerably more active for methane oxidation than pure CeO2 prepared by the same citrate route.
Titulo: Redox and catalytic properties of Ce-Zr mixed oxide nanopowders for fuel cell applications
Redox and catalytic properties of Ce-Zr mixed oxide nanopowders for fuel cell applications
